title: Boy Scout rescued from Mount Washington after allergic reaction
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 15-year-old Boy Scout suffered a significant allergic reaction near the summit of Mount Washington on Sunday.
The teen was part of a Connecticut Boy Scout group and received first aid from fellow Scouts and park staff.
Rescue crews used a Snowcat to transport the boy to an ambulance for hospital care after responding around 3 p.m.

title: New owner steps in at Grumpyâ€™s
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Thomas Holmes, 28, becomes the new owner of Grumpy's on Route 6A, East Dennis, keeping all existing operations unchanged.
The restaurant sale generated interest from six serious buyers but Holmes secured it without disclosing the purchase price.
Holmes aims to maintain Grumpy's iconic status, acknowledging its flawless condition and plans for preserving its legacy.

title: Local obituary: John Rousanidis, Peabody 33-year-old and crewmember on Lily Jean
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: John Paul Rousanidis, 33, from Peabody, died at sea on January 30, 2026, while on the fishing vessel Lily Jean.
Rousanidis was raised in Peabody, moved to Greece at 8, and later served in the Greek Army before returning to the U.S.
A memorial service will be held at St. Vasilios Greek Orthodox Church in Peabody on February 20, 2026.

title: What experts are saying about a possible Patriots trade for Maxx Crosby
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Patriots are considering trading for 28-year-old Raiders defensive end Maxx Crosby to strengthen their defense.
Maxx Crosby has 69.5 sacks in seven seasons, making him a top defensive player in the NFL.
Patriots' salary cap and quarterback Drake Maye's rookie contract create potential for investing in Crosby.

title: Local obituary: Sgt. Freeman Short, 31-year-old Marshfield native and Lily Jean crewmember
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Sgt. Freeman Short, 31, a Marshfield native, was lost at sea as a crew member of the F/V Lily Jean.
Freeman grew up in Maine, was a 2013 Presque Isle High graduate, and served in the Maine Army National Guard.
Visitation is on February 16 at MacDonald Funeral Home; funeral Mass on February 17 at St. Christine Parish Church.

title: Police seek suspect in $15K purse theft
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Worcester police seek help identifying a suspect in $15,000 purse theft from Sweet Jane's Designer Consignment.
The theft occurred last week; suspect seen wearing winter coat and hat in surveillance images.
Police released images of a suspect and vehicle; tips can be submitted via phone or text to Worcester PD.

title: Push for more housing in Union Square hinges on zoning change
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: The Hamilton Company submitted a zoning amendment in Somerville for a 180-unit residential project in Union Square.
The proposed development includes two six-story mixed-use buildings requiring zoning changes for residential expansion.
The project will meet Somerville's 20% inclusionary requirement for affordable housing, offering 2- and 3-bedroom units.

title: Hanover, Mass. woman killed while sunbathing in Florida is identified
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Anastasia Fiona Ullman, 65, was killed by a Jeep while sunbathing in Fort Pierce, Florida, on February 7.
Ullman, from Hanover, was in Florida caring for her mother and was struck as a Jeep crashed into a pool area.
A celebration of Ullman's life will be held at the South Weymouth Church of the Nazarene on Saturday.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the ‘super active’ weather pattern ahead
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston-area forecasters predict a 'super active' weather pattern with rain turning to snow Wednesday night.
Snow accumulations of 1-3 inches expected Wednesday, especially in higher elevations north and west of the city.
A coastal storm with potential snowfall is possible Sunday night into Monday, following Friday's rain-snow mix.

title: Tiffani Faison opens new restaurant Tigerbaby at High Street Place
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Tigerbaby, a new restaurant by Tiffani Faison, opens at High Street Place in downtown Boston on February 17, 2026.
Tigerbaby offers counter-service Southeast Asian cuisine, drawing inspiration from Faison's former restaurant Tiger Mama, including Thai and Vietnamese dishes.
Tigerbaby is the fifth concept at High Street Place from Faison's Big Heart Hospitality, joining Bubble Bath, Charming Gardener, Dive Bar, and Tenderoni's.
